clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Anticipated Regret Incorporation Into Patient Decision Aids
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Anticipated Regret on Decision-Making in Preference Sensitive Care for Breast and Prostate Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the impact of incorporating "anticipated regret " into standard patient decision aids. Participants in the Wharton Behavioral Lab will be administered a standard patient decision aid and an "anticipated regret" augmented decision aid. Participants will complete a computerized survey about their experiences with each version, and their answers will be assessed for potential differences associated with the incorporation of "Anticipated Regret."

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will be recruited through the Wharton Behavioral Lab. Upon arrival males will be provided with two decision aids focusing on prostate cancer, while females will be provided with two decision aids focusing on early breast cancer. One of these decision aids will be a standard version, and one of these will be the anticipated regret-augmented version. Participants will be randomized to which version they receive first to minimize the effect of presentation order. After reviewing the materials, participants will immediately complete a computerized survey at their work stations that will ask them to answer questions based on the materials presented as well as how any hypothetical treatment decisions they would be asked to make would have been influenced by them. Because these are healthy subjects participating in a hypothetical decision-making process for sole purpose of research, the intervention can neither be categorized as experimental or as the standard of care.

primary_outcome.description: Compare decisions about a hypothetical surgery for breast cancer, and examined whether regret is a consideration in treatment decisions.

arm_group.description: Males will receive standard decision aid version for prostate cancer. Females will receive standard decisions aid for early stage breast cancer.
Males will receive anticipated regret-augmented version for prostate cancer. Females will receive anticipated regret-augmented version for early breast cancer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy males and females ages 18 years or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under age 18 years
